comment.author: 14099207@N07
comment._content: A lot of old train stations in Argentina look like this nowadays!

comment.author: 22919290@N08
comment._content: Lovely portrait of the station, fortunately it still survives. This photo was featured on a BBC railway walk series about 15 years ago in which Mrs Lawlor was interviewed (not sure if she is still around today), I tried to recreate the image myself when I visited Borris.

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: Beaten to the Streetview, I will play my OS 25" link.

comment.author: 47245575@N04
comment._content: Nice shot love the old station and lady.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/flyingsnail] That's lovely to know. I've added your info in the description above. Who was Mrs Lawlor? Was she Station "Master"? Was such a thing possible back in the day, or was she Mrs Station Master?
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 22919290@N08
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/nlireland] She was described as been the last 'halt keeper' at Borris, the station had been downgraded to a halt by closure. I recorded the programe on VHS years back, so I must root it out again sometime!

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/flyingsnail] Excellent, thank you! Added "halt keeper" to description and tags.
